act_pit.actname: Trade, Investment and Labour Mobility Agreement Implementation Act

change.changenote: Section 4 BEFORE self-repealed by 2008-39-4(3), effective March 31, 2011.

subsection.subsectiontext: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations for the purposes of implementing the Agreement or the amendments made by this Act to other Acts, including, without limiting this, to remedy any transitional difficulties encountered in implementing the Agreement or amendments made by this Act to other Acts.
A regulation made under this section may be made retroactive to a date not earlier than April 1, 2007, and if made retroactive

paragraph.paragraphtext: is deemed to come into force on the date specified in the regulation, and
is retroactive to the extent necessary to give it force and effect on the date specified in the regulation.

subsection.subsectiontext: This section is repealed two years after it is brought into force and on its repeal any regulations made under it are also repealed.

change.changenote: Section 79 (1) BEFORE amended by 2016-5-41,Sch 3, effective March 10, 2016 (Royal Assent).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An application of a person for enrollment as a member under the Notaries Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 334, that was commenced before the coming into force of this section and the amendments made by this Act to sections 5, 6 and 11 of the Notaries Act is deemed to be an application for enrollment without a limitation on the member's practice relating to a notarial district or area.
